title: Zed nerf: Shadows expire twice as fast under turrets
body: I mean if Azir uses mana and gets to outrange people,while zed is free why shouldnt he share the drawback?

replies.body:
How about because Zeds shadow has a 14 second CD and Azir's soldiers have a 8 second CD. And the soldiers can attack multiple times whereas Zed has 1 Q and max 2 Es per shadow.

And Azir only spends mana on the soldier cast, not the actual damage, whereas Zed spends all of his energy bar just to do a single ranged combo.

And then gets a good bit of it back. Then waits those 14 seconds and does it again. 

Azir's soldiers can be walked out of much easier than avoiding Zed swapping with his shadow and pushing R on you. 

Azir also wont be tower diving you unless you're a for sure kill and he has an escape plan. In which case Zed would of killed you already while Azir was working on his plan. 

Not saying this idea would fix him. But your counter augment isn't very strong.

Good bit of it back... He gets 40/80 energy back IF he lands both skills. If he is landing his E while youre under tower, youre doing something very wrong.

And a single poke pattern every 14 seconds is really really fucking weak among ALL mid laners. So the fact that it is manaless is what balanced that out.

Considering most have to wait about 14ish seconds to have the mana to actually be able to poke properly without going oom? Yeeaah. Base regen for most is around 6-8ish per second, then 3 from Doran's. When your abilities to poke cost 50-60 and do half the damage of Zed's Q? Well, that means you need to toss it twice to match his damage, but it's also hard to compete with 1450 ranged Q. All you have to do is toss the clone behind the caster minions then toss the Q, do quite a large amount of damage from the one ability and if you manage to also be able to E the person, you get 2 seconds off your W's CD. Most Zed runs 5% CDR runes then another 5% from masteries, rush the Brutalizer for a total of 20%. That 18s CD just turned into a 14.4s CD, 12.4s if you land the E, which against a short ranged mage who's trying to counter-poke against your 1450 ranged W+Q combo, it's not too hard.

I should also note how I'm getting 1450. His shadow goes 550 range in the direction of your choosing. His Q has a 900 range. I should note Ezreal's Q is a 1150 as a comparison of poke power. Comparing him to other champions as well, Ziggs' Q has an 850 range to toss the bomb and can bounce up to 1400, though let's face it, if you're hit by the bouncing Q, you're likely bad at sidestepping or slowed. And for even more 'WTF' is Nidalee's spear is 1500. Only 50 range more than Zed's combo. Yes, the dreaded death spear BARELY out ranges Zed's W+Q combo. 

I will also note that the change mentioned won't actually affect Zed in really any way since his R Shadow is never under the turret to begin with since he'll R you from out of the turret range and now be in the turret range. His W only lasts for 4 seconds and most Zeds just W then instantly Q and that shadow is pretty much useless unless your opponent is stupid enough to walk near it for you to press E OR you decide to teleport to it so you can R. Either way, if you halved its time, that's only 2s. Not... really effective...
The longer he throws it from, the easier it is to dodge.

you are forgetting that Zed's W Q combo range reduces the amount of over all damage he deals... If he is in range for his Q and his W's Q then he deals more damage. The range is _meant_ to be like that... His kit makes the enemy have to realize where all his shadows are located at. If zed has the time to walk 1450 sum units away, and the enemy is still standing right on top of the shadow, then they are doing something wrong.

Wut. Why would you walk away from some one as Zed? I'm saying his max range is 1450, that means he has more than the entire screen to hit you with a Q, which even if both don't hit, the single one will hurt. The only reason Zed's poke is usually a bit small early on is because he throws it through minions. With a boosted 550 from the shadow and a decent knowledge of how his Q works, you can hit anyone with at least one. 

Considering this range though, as I mentioned, this idea to reduce his shadow duration under the turret is useless. Zed doesn't stuff his shadow under the turret to sit there for the entire duration.

I assume the OP is mainly thinking of lanning phase. Which he will only be getting 20 back. IMO Zed is fine late game as is if he is talking about late game. This is why Riot claims he's a healthy assassin. How he assassinates after lanning phase is fine. It's his early game power that makes problems happen. Although with more tank junglers and fewer fighters that synergize with assassins, he has not been as bad. 

That's still 10% of his resource pool. More than Azir will get back from regen in the time it takes for Zed's shadow to come back up. That is a good bit. Not amazing, but it's enough. 

Assuming level 6. Rank 3 Q, Rank 1 W and E. Full combo costs 155. Hitting both Q's makes brings it down to 135. He will regen this before his shadow is available again. Azir cannot repeatedly harass like this. He will go OOM. Since he wont likely be casting W on cooldown, he'll probably get an extra Q or two in there as well between shadows without running into energy problems. 

Again,  not saying I support the OP's idea. But Zed has it a lot easier and has fewer restrictions on harassing targets under their tower.

> [{quoted}](name=MiIey Virus,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=Av3qPyN2,comment-id=000300010000000000000000,timestamp=2015-05-06T01:49:12.475+0000)

Average/mediocre doesn't mean bad. It just means that there's nothing incredibly special about him. Compare this to pre-nerf Sejuani after Cinderhulk came in, or Warwick after the introduction of Devourer. It's not that Zed is bad, and in my opinion, he shouldn't BECOME bad. But he's not particularly amazing, either. Even in highly competitive games, Zed falls off late game; teamfights roll around and he's got one, yes one, single shot at killing somebody. When he fails, he's left to poke, poke, poke, using his rather weakly scaling shurikens. 

Further, if you look in competitive play, it's very very rare you'll see a Zed win lane or even PUSH a good Cho'gath or Urgot into tower. 

Again, Zed is not bad. Nor is he amazing. I honestly feel like he's in a rather good place, balance-wise. He's a split pusher **by design** because he is one of the **only** assassins who a) does NOT have some form of reset on kill/assist and b) has a very long cooldown on his ultimate.

Compare this to Leblanc, who has a short cooldown in addition to the ability to do loads of damage using her 3 basic abilities, or Katarina, the Reset Queen, who can ult twice in a single fight, or Talon, the AOE God of burst assassins. 

As somebody previously mentioned, this is the key:

People don't complain about champions they have issues with during the latter part of the game, because everything is all mixed together. People **only** tend to complain about early/mid-game dominant champions because those are the ones they have to deal with personally. This was the problem with Lee Sin, this is the problem people see with Leblanc, and this is the problem people see with Zed. Each of these three champions has a dominant laning phase and an incredibly difficult late-game. This creates a *perception* of being more powerful than say, Xerath, despite Xerath being undisputably more helpful in teamfights and poke as the game goes on longer and longer.

Honestly, my only real problem with Zed personally is just how safe he is in 1v1 dueling.  He can ult someone, proc his mark, stand around and see if he needs to add in another few autoattacks or wait for his cooldowns again or just chill for a few years over your corpse, and his ult shadow is still sitting there waiting to give him a trip back to safety.

It's bad enough that towers mean absolutely nothing to Zed, but he can dive so far and so long and still be safe with his ult because the return trip lasts forever.  I think it's a cool ability, but I really wish the time on the shadow forced Zed to make a decision rather than being able to wait past the ult's timer and still getting the trip back.
